availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Irwin Hollowell, Sr. (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Mary A. Hollowell. Father of Isaac Hollowell, Robert Hollowell, Irwin Hollowell, Jr., Mildred A. Hollowell, and William T. Hollowell. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Long Pond in 1860. Owned forty-one enslaved persons in Long Pond in 1860. Held six enslaved persons in trust for Jane Parker in Long Lond in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 372A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Long Pond Division, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Long Pond Division, p. 214A.
"Irwin Hollowell (1796-1876)," Find A Grave, Memorial #169986520, accessed September 14, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/169986520.
